ygData.subject: Re: Banks
ygData.msgSnippet: How long did it take you to get to level 3??  I did it fairly quickly... Only took a couple of hours!  In fact, I had level one done in less than an hour.. I
ygData.messageBody:
How long did it take you to get to level 3?? I did it fairly quickly...
Only took a couple of hours! In fact, I had level one done in less than an
hour..

I was up to level 5 within the next 3-4 hours of play time (over a couple of
days for me) with a little help from another cleric friend (Thanks Devrill!)
who gave me a couple of pieces of patchwork armor (she was learning
tailoring) basically at cost and or free... I gave her pelts (and still do!)

So your point of not being able to take on toughies in the first level is
true, yes, but you also don't NEED to really... But you won't DIE because
some Orc Pawn starts slamming on you either... your armor is likely to help
you get back to the guards a LITTLE easier if it's banded or plate!

Then, when it comes time to start hunting Centurions and the like, you will
be up on the game again, with higher AC and such... That's all.. If you
like that, then fine... I found myself going out and getting killed ON
PURPOSE so that I could have more food and water without having to pay for
it! Guess if I could have just gotten say, 100 plat right off the bat I
wouldn't have to waste time killing myself... hehe... But it was good
practice on looting my corpse.... hehe...

Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server


----- Original Message -----
From: David Burkhart <davidb@...>
To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, May 28, 1999 9:59 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Banks


> From: davidb@... (David Burkhart)
>
> Yeah they took care of twinking to a certain degree. Granted having Banded
> Mail at 1st level would certainly help you. However at 1st level your
> Offense and Defense are low, as is your weapon skill. Believe it our not,
it
> doesn't make a huge difference.
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Ed Coyle [mailto:ecoyle@...]
> > Sent: Friday, May 28, 1999 12:47 PM
> > To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Banks
> >
> >
> > From: "Ed Coyle" <ecoyle@...>
> >
> > It would take you several days to get up to 10th level, regardless of
what
> > armor or weapons you have. AC on a twinked character, even if he/she is
> > wearing banded, is still not very high until you get to a higher
> > level. You
> > wouldn't be able to fight red MOBs very much, because even though
> > you have a
> > FS Longsword, your 1h slashing skill might only be 30.
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Lemac Justerian [mailto:lemac@...]
> > > Sent: Friday, May 28, 1999 12:35 PM
> > > To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
> > > Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Banks
> > >
> > >
> > > From: "Lemac Justerian" <lemac@...>
> > >
> > > Joint bank accounts wouldn't be that great of an idea... For the
> > > reasons you
> > > stated, it would, but it would be abused too easily to help
> > > *twink* another
> > > character up...
> > >
> > > I think you would start seeing even more (there already are some)
lower
> > > level characters wearing the best armor and having the best weapons
that
> > > money can buy because they are 'sharing' those items with the 'other'
> > > player...
> > >
> > > In other words: I have a level 18 character that has all banded
> > > armor and a
> > > Combine Staff - I put it into the bank, log out, log back on as a NEW
> > > character that is level 1... he puts on the armor, grabs the
> > staff, and in
> > > just a few hours he is up to level 10! Not worrying much about
getting
> > > killed off because his AC is around 300 or so!
> > >
> > > No, no sharing of accounts... BUT, I WOULD like to see some way
> > > for GUILDS
> > > to have a 'seperate' account (for officers) to make it easier to
> > > handle the
> > > income and outlay of the guilds...
> >
> >
